717154f-a.text:
Broadway,from Park Place to Chambers Street,showing
City Hall Park.
1867.
Irving Underhill,Photographer,
Credit line Imperative.

717187f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, from Park Place (left) to Warren (right) Street's, as photographed across City Hall Park and it's contained City Hall, from the Pulitzer (World) Building. Thru the center runs Murray Street. At the N. W. corner is the Postal Telegraph Building. Adjoining same is the taller Home Life Insurance Co. Building. In the background is the North (Hudson) River and it's Jersey Shore.

About 1897

Gift of Urbrock Collection

717192f-a.text:
239-247 Broadway, west side, north from Park Place to Murray Street.
Notice the Woolworth Building on the extreme left.
About 1924.
Gift of E. M. Jenks.

717193f-b.text:
(1)
239 to 247 Broadway, west side, north from Park Place (left) to Murray Street (right) as viewed westward from City Hall Park. Partially
shown on the extreme left is the Woolworth Building.
October 30, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A detail of the same, showing only Nos. 241 to 247 Broadway.
October 30, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

717186f-a.text:
Broadway, north from Park Place, as photographed across the former site of the old Post Office. This is the apex of the triangular City Hall Park formed at the point of convergence by Park Row and Broadway. The buildings shown are on the west side of the latter. Chambers Street is on the right. View No. 2 is limited to the blockfront ertending from Park
Place to Murray Street.
May 5, 1940
No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr

Broadway, north from Park Place, as photographed across the former site of the old Post Office. View No. 2 is limited to the blockfront ertending from Park
Place to Murray Street.
May 5, 1940
No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr
